title: Meaning Crisis or Crisis of Hope? Agapic Love, Randos and A Grief Observed
description:
A discussion of what the meaning crisis is, how it shows itself in various avenues of life and how it intersects with a loss of hope. A look at how hope arises out of the life, death and resurrection of Jesus Christ and how that changed the world. We looked at our own lives to determine some of the reasons for hopelessness, isolation, denial.

We pursued John Vervaeke's idea that agape love calls the object of love into being as a sculptor discovers his subject in the stone or as an artist finds the subject within the chaos on the canvas and how that relates to each of us in our personal journey through pain, chaos and the adventure of learning who we are and whose we are.

Mary and Shari bring joy to the conversation.

Reading with Randos: A Grief Observed by C. S. Lewis
https://youtu.be/WrsJInvreWs

Shari with Jeff on
Reading with Randos: Spirits in Bondage by C. S. Lewis 
https://youtu.be/tNnOHUWL2pQ

Mary Kochan: Joseph Ratzinger enters the conversation
https://youtu.be/OnpcOS2VvmI

At the cross, at the cross where I first saw the light
and the burden of my soul rolled away,
It was there by faith I received my sight, 
and now I am happy all the day.  Let's rephrase that; Now I have hope.
